text: Thank you AJ, let me take a look into that. I will let you know how it works.

Also <@U2H3TT8F2> if you don't mind, I have another question regarding the clickable image banner in a module I recently used.

The image banner used to be non-clilcable with no option to add URL link in the dashboard, So I did some customization in the back end. It turns out to have the external URL option but after inserting the anchor link '#assettracer' and save then refresh the page. It doesn't work as expected, it does reload the page and works as refreshing the current page.

This is the page I am talking about <http://www.realtimenetworks.com|www.realtimenetworks.com>
Hello, does anyone know if it is possible to import a group of fields in a module?

I believe your issue is that your `<a>` link doesnt have content. I would move your span (line 13-15)  inside your `<a>` tag (around line 29). That should then make that larger image (the clickable ones) be able to be the linked item.

Yes, it works! one last question: I found a tricky thing after updating the coding file as you taught me. If I didn't insert a link in the URL field, the image won't show-up even if I have attached an image in the box image field in the dashboard.
So in the current mode If I just want a non-clickable image banner, I will have no image displayed in the live page.

You can use an IF statement to evaluate if there is a value in the link field. I had to step away from a computer but this doc should help <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/if-statements|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/if-statements>

Not natively â€” but there are a few tools that make this possible. <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@spingroup/parachute/v/1.0.1|Parachute> as well as <https://github.com/iGoMoon/HubSpot-tools/tree/main/packages/HubSpot-fields-js|HubSpot Fields JS>

Both are webpack plugins but HS Fields JS can also be used with just Node and no webpack
